sentences.sContent: This business plan looks very professional.
sentences.sCn: 这个商业计划看上去很有专业水平。

sentences.sContent: a more professional approach to work
...he has since become a professional painter...
...Some people regard professional change as an unpleasant experience that disturbs their stable careers...
...almost all of us will experience a period of radical professional change...
...those books are a set of professional books used by English majors in our school...
...the most important character doctor should have is professional ethics that is the foremost way to gain trust from patients...
...it could be a great way to connect with academic and professional resources at your university...
...The professional name for covering up a symptom is masking...
...Did you know then that you would become a professional violinist...
...I did what any professional writer would do，I hurried off to spread the good news...
...Women's liberation opened up new professional opportunities for women...
...The price of professional childcare has been rising since the 1980s...
...ledge economy where professional roles change rapidly and many college students are preparing for positions that may not even exist yet...
...A new study shows a large gender gap on economic policy among the nation's professional economists...
...I began to slip both in health and professional terms...

synos.tran: 专业的；职业的；职业性的

phrases.pCn: 工作经验；工作经历；职业经验
职业经理人；专业管理者
行业标准；专业标准；职业标准

words.tran: 在表面上；公然地；专业地
职业，专业；声明，宣布，表白
专业主义；专家的地位；特性或方法

trans.tranOther: showing that someone has been well trained and is good at their work

trans.tranCn: 自由职业者， 专业人员
trans.tranOther: someone who earns money by doing a job, sport, or activity that many other people do just for fun
